brand_info.name: Hermès
brand_info.positioning: An independent, family-owned French house at the pinnacle of discreet luxury, defined by exceptional craftsmanship, timeless design, and poetic creativity across leather goods, silk, ready-to-wear, jewelry, and home.
brand_info.vision: To keep craftsmanship alive and forward-looking, creating timeless and durable objects that transcend trends through a spirit of freedom, invention, and cultural curiosity.
brand_info.mission: To design and craft timeless, durable objects and experiences, safeguarding and passing on exceptional savoir-faire while combining artisanal excellence with creativity, innovation, and responsible practice.
brand_info.origin_story: Founded in Paris in 1837 by Thierry Hermès as a harness and saddlery workshop serving an elite clientele, the house evolved from equestrian equipment into a global luxury maison while remaining rooted in handcraft, material mastery, and a distinctive blend of heritage and playful imagination.

brand_values.brand_promise: Every Hermès creation delivers enduring quality, tactile pleasure, and quiet distinction, expressing the house’s artisanal mastery and poetic spirit without compromise.
differentiators: Uncompromising artisanal know-how and material mastery across métiers
Iconic codes and recognizable details expressed with restraint rather than loud branding
A poetic, playful, and inventive creative culture that elevates everyday objects into lasting companions
non_negotiables: No shortcuts on materials, construction, or finishing
No overt discounting or price-led messaging that diminishes craft value
No visual or verbal loudness that replaces subtlety, wit, and refinement

psychographics.lifestyle: Culturally fluent global clients who value rarity, provenance, and the pleasure of well-made objects. They travel, collect, and invest in pieces that become personal signatures, preferring quality and service over hype.
psychographics.behavior: Selective and loyal buyers who appreciate craftsmanship and limited availability, often building wardrobes and object collections over time. They seek pieces that feel personal and enduring, with minimal overt logos and maximum tactile quality.

tone_of_voice.communication_style: Minimal, precise, and evocative, with lightness and quiet intelligence
preferred_structures: Short, memorable lines that suggest a story
Craft-led statements grounded in materials and making
Playful titles and campaign phrases that feel like modern fables
tone_of_voice.emotional_temperature: Warm, airy, and imaginative, with controlled elegance
tone_dos: Let craft and imagination speak through suggestion and metaphor
Keep copy sparse, leaving space for the image to carry the narrative
tone_donts: Aggressive CTAs, shouting typography, or price/discount cues
Overly technical jargon that feels industrial rather than artisanal

logo.primary_logo: HERMÈS PARIS wordmark with the house emblem (horse-drawn carriage and groom) used as the primary signature
logo.usage_rules: Use the logo as a refined signature with generous breathing room. Maintain high contrast and avoid overlaying on busy, high-detail areas. Never distort, rotate, recolor with gradients, or apply effects.
logo.lockup_behavior: Typically centered or slightly offset near the top or bottom, scaled modestly relative to the composition to preserve elegance and narrative focus
logo.safe_area: Keep clear space around the logo equal to at least the emblem height on all sides

color_system.color_usage_rules: Hermès orange is the key accent, used sparingly to create instant recognition. Base fields are clean whites and warm neutrals, with black for typography and occasional airy pastels in backgrounds. Avoid loud multicolor palettes unless controlled as a poetic, editorial gesture.

typography.primary_font: Hermès house wordmark (custom serif) for the logo signature
typography.secondary_font: Elegant serif or clean sans-serif for supporting copy (light to regular weights, high legibility)
hierarchy: H1 – Sparse headline or campaign phrase with generous tracking
H2 – Secondary line aligned to the logo rhythm
Body – Minimal supporting copy, never dense

layout_principles.grid_system: Single-image poster layout with strong negative space and a clear signature zone for logo and headline
layout_principles.white_space_ratio: High use of negative space to emphasize mystery and craft
layout_principles.image_vs_text_balance: Image-dominant, text as a discreet signature
layout_principles.cta_placement: If present, small and secondary, aligned near the logo zone with minimal hierarchy
layout_principles.alignment: Centered or gently asymmetrical, always balanced and airy

preferred_photographers: Illustration and still-life artists for product narratives
style.camera_feel: Cinematic, airy frames that read like a modern fable, mixing real locations with playful, surreal scale and unexpected juxtapositions
style.pose_guidelines: Natural, elegant gestures with a sense of movement and breeze. Bodies feel relaxed yet composed, often captured mid-action to suggest freedom and story
style.casting_attitude: Confident, curious, and serene. Faces and bodies carry quiet presence rather than performance, with styling that feels effortless and elevated

technical.lighting: Naturalistic, soft daylight or diffused studio light, often with gentle bloom and controlled highlights
technical.contrast: Moderate, with clean separation and a premium, refined roll-off in highlights
technical.grain: Very subtle, sometimes a fine film-like texture to add warmth and tactility
technical.depth_of_field: Variable: shallow for intimate product emphasis, deeper for storytelling tableaux where environment and object coexist
technical.color_grading: Clean and luminous with restrained saturation, using Hermès orange as the dominant accent and keeping skin tones and neutrals natural

preferred_locations: Airy coastal or island landscapes with open skies
Snowfields, deserts, and wide natural horizons used as minimalist stages
Architectural settings with quiet elegance and strong geometry
contexts: Surreal narrative scenes where objects feel like characters
Lifestyle moments elevated into gentle fantasy
Product-as-hero compositions that integrate craft details into the story world

model_casting.diversity: Yes, inclusive casting aligned with elegance and presence
model_casting.attitude: Light, self-possessed, and calm, with subtle curiosity and ease

product_presentation.hero_visibility: Always clear and readable, integrated into the scene as the story anchor rather than a pasted-in packshot
product_presentation.styling_approach: Understated styling that lets material, color, and construction speak. Accessories and props are carefully curated and never cluttered.
avoid: Overcrowded sets, noisy backgrounds, and trend-chasing aesthetics
Heavy retouching that removes natural texture and material truth

motion_rules.pacing: If animated, movements are slow, floaty, and graceful, like wind, fabric, and gentle camera drift
motion_rules.transitions: Soft cuts or dissolves, no aggressive effects, maintaining a dreamy continuity

visual_dos: Use Hermès orange as a decisive, minimal accent
Build compositions around negative space, wit, and material tactility
Create gentle surrealism with real-world photographic credibility
visual_donts: Do not use loud graphic overlays or cluttered layouts
Do not over-brand or dominate the image with large logos
Do not rely on generic luxury tropes without a narrative twist
copy_dos: Keep copy sparse, elegant, and suggestive
Use short campaign phrases that feel like a fable title
copy_donts: Avoid sales language, urgency, and discount framing
Avoid long paragraphs and explanatory copy

must_remain: Integrity of the Hermès signature and emblem usage
Craft-first truth in materials, finishing, and construction detail
Poetic restraint: elegance with wit, never loudness
can_evolve: Casting and cultural references while staying refined
Digital formats and motion language as long as they remain airy and crafted
Narrative concepts that reinterpret heritage with contemporary imagination
test_zone: Pop-ups and immersive experiences that extend the fable world
Digital-first storytelling prototypes with controlled brand signatures

materials: Warm woods, leather, stone, and artisanal surfaces with impeccable finishing
Brass or bronze accents with understated shine
Textiles and leathers showcased as tactile objects, not mere decor
interactive_elements: Quiet storytelling windows and displays with crafted props
Selective digital touchpoints that never overpower products
Personal service rituals emphasizing provenance and craft
retail.soundscape: Soft ambient soundscapes, classical or contemporary minimal music at low volume, preserving intimacy

digital.tone_adjustment: Website and e-commerce remain clean, craft-led, and editorial; social channels amplify the playful fable tone with minimal captions; newsletters stay concise, curated, and premium.

platform_behavior.Instagram: Poetic hero images, short captions, strong negative space, signature logo placement
platform_behavior.Website: Editorial storytelling with craft details, clean layout, and controlled use of orange accents
platform_behavior.Newsletter: Minimal design, one hero image, short copy blocks, clear but discreet navigation

print.paper: Premium uncoated or lightly textured stocks that enhance tactility and color depth, with excellent reproduction of orange and neutrals
print.cover_rules: Full-bleed image with generous breathing room; logo and headline placed as a refined signature, never crowded

logo_misuse_examples: Stretching or warping the wordmark or emblem
Placing the logo over busy, high-frequency textures that reduce legibility
Using gradients, shadows, or novelty effects on the logo
